Class HospitalPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • HospitalPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, Refreshable

    public class HospitalPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements Refreshable
    Instances of HospitalPanel are components of Game objects. They contain all components related to the Hospital location in-game, and are displayed when the player enters the Hospital.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Removes all components from the apply panel, and adds them again.
      private void refreshStatusPanel()
      Refreshes the status panel by removing and rebuilding all its components.

      • team

        private Team team()
        Provides access to the team associated with the current Game.
        Returns:
        The team associated with this panel's Game.

      • refresh

        Refresh all panels belonging to HospitalPanel which display information which may have changed.

      • addTitlePanel

        private void addTitlePanel()
        Create the title panel and add it to the main window.

      • addSidePanel

        private void addSidePanel()
        Create the side panel and add it to the HospitalPanel

      • addContentPanel

        private void addContentPanel()
        Create the main content panel and add it to the window.

      • addStatusPanel

        private void addStatusPanel()
        Create the status panel used by the main content panel. Remains bare until populated by refreshStatusPanel.

      • refreshStatusPanel

        private void refreshStatusPanel()
        Refreshes the status panel by removing and rebuilding all its components. This ensures any changes in variable components are displayed correctly.

      • addApplyPanel

        private void addApplyPanel()
        Adds the panel allowing the user to apply healing items to heroes to the content panel card layout.

      • refreshApplyPanel

        private void refreshApplyPanel()
        Removes all components from the apply panel, and adds them again.

      • addSelectHeroPanel

        private void addSelectHeroPanel()
        Adds a panel showing each hero on the team, with a radio button allowing the user to select that hero. Each radio button is only enabled if that hero does not already have an applied healing item.

      • addSelectHealingItemPanel

        private void addSelectHealingItemPanel()
        Adds a panel showing each healing item and the number of that healing item owned by the team. Each healing item has a radio button allowing the user to select it, which is only enabled if the team owns at least one of that healing item.

      • refreshApplyButton

        private void refreshApplyButton()
        Enables the Apply button if there is a hero and a healing item selected, otherwise disables it.
